result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
4:18 PM DA Sacia appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person. Attorney Swank appears in person. Defense requests to set for PLEAS. State has no objection. PLEAS set. Bond cont.

3:02 PM Defendant Jacob Richard McFarlane appeared by phone.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for Jacob Richard McFarlane.  Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advised discovery only able to review at DA's office, set aside time on Tuesday to do, requesting additional status. State has no objection. STC set. Bond cont.
Status Conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status Conference on October 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status Conference on September 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:34 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Richard McFarlane in court.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Jacob Richard McFarlane. Defense advised they received offer from the State and would like to request STC 3-4 weeks out to review. Court grants request.  Atty Swank to contact JA for scheduling.   Bond cont.
Status Conference on July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Attorney Swank advised defendant waives reading of information. PTC set. Bond cont. Substitution of Judge requested.

Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Swank states def waives reading of information and enters NG plea. PTC. Bond to continue. Substitution of Judge requested.

9:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Richard McFarlane in court.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Jacob Richard McFarlane. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint.
